Decent sequel that enhances story and characters, which in turn makes puzzles more spread out.
Coop mode makes up for it though, letting you communicate and solve problems together.
pls GabeN, portal 3
One of the best games I've ever played.  Thrilling story & unique puzzles make this one a genre of it's own.

the game has the same controls as the first one, but the rooms are quite different. The beginning is more of a tutorial and then it gets into the more intereesting parts. I think its more complicated then the first one which i like, plus the co-op capabilities. highly suggested game
Portal 2 was a beautiful game. It not only made me question my own sanity, but also the sanity of our future A.I. overlords.

This is the best game ever created as far as I am concerned. The graphics were incredible, the puzzles and unique way of thinking are absolutely wonderful, and the compelling and intriguing story keeps you interested. Puzzle after puzzle await you, and yet changing scenery and situations, along with sarcastic comments with every level, keep it from getting dull. A Portal 3 will be a no-brainer buy for me.
game is gereat has great momntens
Obra maestra
jup.

Not Serious review:

How to play Portal 2:

Step 1: Open up Portal 2.
Step 2: Realize this game is much more different than the first one.
Step 3: Place 2 portals orienting in different directions making your brain melt into a little soup which little minibugs inside it put a portal under and have it infinitely fall until they get tired and drink it.

9001/10 would melt brain again.

Serious review:

This game... is just beautiful. An amazing portal physics adventure. The ending still gets me, seriously. I've finished the game like 3 times now and I still shed a single tear at the ending. It's just straight forward beautiful. And the feeling when you finally get the last singleplayer achievement... this is just beautiful. Thats everything I can say.

10/10.
This is an awesome game!  I would really recommend it!  Totally worth the money!  Has an great story mode that goes with it as well!
So much replay value, after 26 hours online, and many more offline I am certain to recomend this game to anyone who longs for challenge!
A must have for any library

This game is great it is everything that we ( or should i say I) really wanted from the sequel,It has glados the snarky and downtalking robot, wheatley the funny british personality core and much more. This sequel even makes you go through the old facility of aperture BEFORE all the portal and glados stuff happens. It is rich in story( in my own opinion) and everything in this game just makes me want there to be a portal 3( but since the ending so great and i don't want to spiol it let us say it just ends on not having another sequel). SO BUY THIS GAME PEOPLE
Absolutely Fantastic Puzzle Game!!! And the storyline is definitely not lacking!
the story is very good the characthers are really funny and its really just a good game

Very Fun.

Pre-Review: I WOULD recommend this game if it wasn't for the massive amouts of repitition.

So this game... It has the amazing dialogue of Portal. +1
It has improved graphics that has/will continue to age well. +1
It has the same great gameplay from Portal with extra mechanics. +1
It adds a set of new chracters to the story to make it more interesting, and answers questions left in the first game. +1

Why do I not recommend it then?
It's...So...Bloody... LONG!
That wouldn't be a problem except a good half of the game is the exact same gameplay from the last game, with slightly different puzzles.
A few of the puzzles did put up  a challenge, and that's great, but towards the final quarter of the game after all of the gameplay elements and mechanics have been introduced and firmly set, it just gets REPETITIVE

So much repitition, sure they're different rooms, but the difficulty curves are off. Some are so easy they could be in the first couple of tests, some are so difficult they make you stop and think.

AND IT'S REALLY REPETITIVE.

So you're listening to what  - for the most part - is filler dilalogue, while doing these test chambers.

DID I MENTION HOW REPETITIVE IT WAS?

If it didn't have the horrible repitition, it would easily be worth a recommendation, but I can't recommend it because of the MASS AMOUNTS OF REPITITION.
Altamente recomendado!
Played the multiplyar once with a random person. Sat there for 2 minutes waving at each other.
Very good game

Portal 2 is seriously one of  my most favorite games of all time. For a very low-end game (for my low-end pc), Portal 2 brings along a great storyline, continuing off from when Chell defeated GlaDOS.
